body_html:
@han-qiu, I did (cuDNN 6, on MacOS 10.11.6 using CLT 8.2), but then I realized it was this may be the last release to support CUDA 8 so I upgraded to 10.13 and CUDA 9.1 (cuDNN 7.0.5, CLT 8.3.2) so I don't have the package anymore. Likely wouldn't work anyway unless it was compiled using -march=core2

I played around with using LLVM (non-Apple Clang) and kinda wanna circle back to making that work.

body:
@han-qiu, I did (cuDNN 6, on MacOS 10.11.6 using CLT 8.2), but then I realized it was this may be the last release to support CUDA 8 so I upgraded to 10.13 and CUDA 9.1 (cuDNN 7.0.5, CLT 8.3.2) so I don't have the package anymore. Likely wouldn't work anyway unless it was compiled using -march=core2

I played around with using LLVM (non-Apple Clang) and kinda wanna circle back to making that work.
